synopsis: In episode #9 of the podcast, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome guest Vivek Menon, who shares his exciting journey in filmmaking and the creation of his series 'New Normal.' The conversation dives deep into the challenges and joys of expressing creativity, the importance of representation, and the value of embracing one's identity as an artist.
quotes: You can't be afraid to put your stuff out there and watch it with people who support you.
The best way of learning is by doing it and putting yourself out there.
A passion isn't something you have; a passion is something that develops through practice.
If there's something that has been on the back of your mind that you've always wanted to do, throw yourself into it.
You will definitely learn something about yourself, even if it's that you don't want to do this again.
It's not about the amount of views; it's about the value and joy you find in creating.
You should call yourself what you want to be; no one else is going to do it for you.
It's okay to have a mental block about your identity as an artist; just keep pushing through.
The journey is just as important as the destination, if not more so.
If you can prove to people that you're for real, the work will talk for itself.
